abstract: Majority of Supreme Court justices seem unconvinced during oral arguments that University of Texas affirmative action plan is unconstitutional, and ruling against university could imperil affirmative action at institutions of higher education across nation; Justice Antonin Scalia adds to controversy in case when he announces his belief that minority students with lower than average grades might perform better at lesser institution.
lead_paragraph: A majority of the justices seemed unpersuaded on Wednesday that an affirmative action plan at the University of Texas was constitutional.

headline.main: Supreme Court Justices’ Comments Don’t Bode Well for Affirmative Action
headline.print_headline: Court Skeptical of Weighing Race in College Entry

snippet: A majority of the justices seemed unpersuaded on Wednesday that an affirmative action plan at the University of Texas was constitutional.
